column1: The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program or CFAP provides direct disaster assistance to farmers and producers who have experienced losses due to COVID-19. Don’t miss your opportunity to apply for these funds before December 11. Find the application here: https://t.co/narTTUjvYl

Lexington ARC in Schoharie County provides critically important services & programs for young people & adults living with disabilities. I appreciate the opportunity to meet with the leadership team & learn more about how they have adjusted their programming during COVID-19. https://t.co/mVI7jwRHkX

If you’re a farmer in #NY19 who has experienced losses during the COVID-19 pandemic – contact your local FSA to see if you qualify for disaster assistance through CFAP 2 & reach out to my office with additional questions at (845) 443-2930. https://t.co/M9U0g3ELGN

During #AmericanEducationWeek we celebrate the educators working to teach our young people while navigating the COVID-19 pandemic. I will continue to support teachers & advocate for investments in rural broadband infrastructure so every student can access the virtual classroom.

During the COVID pandemic access to affordable quality health coverage is more important than ever. Enrollment in https://t.co/VEwqJxTLaQ is open until Dec. 15. Coverage may be more affordable than you think. Last year nearly 9 in 10 folks received financial help. #GetCovered https://t.co/GvuWWVdTRQ

#NY19 is home to world-famous summer camps that have faced economic challenges due to COVID-19. Today I connected w camp directors from across our district to better understand how they’re navigating the pandemic & how I can help advocate for their success at the federal level. https://t.co/cKVrrXINtA

This morning I had a great virtual meeting with @FCNL members from all across #NY19. During our conversation we discussed our shared concern over the urgent need for additional coronavirus relief legislation that meets the needs of our communities across upstate. https://t.co/GDuFhaIo6S

On Thursday my Agriculture Advisory Committee discussed the importance of ensuring farmers know about CFAP-2’s simplified application process. If your farm has experienced losses due to COVID-19 apply today for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. https://t.co/jL9NlHYIKs

Important reminder for fire departments in #NY19: today is the last day to apply for the second round of the Assistance to Firefighters Grants COVID-19 Supplemental. Learn more here to see if you qualify and submit your application today. ↓ https://t.co/2dHSIBkys1

COVID-19 cases are climbing across the country and upstate NY and I am grateful for the opportunity to connect with my Health Care Advisory Committee to hear firsthand about their experiences in medical facilities and understand how they are preparing for the colder months. https://t.co/Vg8JO3epSb

Applications for CFAP 2 close in just under a month. If you are a farmer who has experienced losses due to COVID-19 don’t miss this opportunity to apply for direct disaster assistance through @USDA. Click here to see if you qualify: https://t.co/jL9NlHYIKs

Our communities all across #NY19 continue to find ways to honor the service of our veterans while maintaining social distance. I was humbled to join the Dutchess County #VeteransDay convoy today and see folks throughout the county wave and pay tribute to our veterans. https://t.co/vGQaISz51N

The COVID-19 pandemic has created additional hardships for agriculture producers across upstate NY. That’s why last week I announced new federal grant funding for @YoungFarmers that will help expand the Farm Ranch Stress Assistance Network in the Northeast.https://t.co/dEeppykUTY

Our nation continues to face record numbers of #COVID19 cases – and it is incumbent upon all of us to take steps to slow the spread. I encourage everyone to listen to the advice of experts practice social distancing and wear a mask. https://t.co/mOqtgkcqSc

Applications are open now for a second round of the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. CFAP provides disaster assistance for farmers who have experienced losses due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more here and apply before the December 11 deadline: https://t.co/jL9NlHYIKs

If you are a farmer in #NY19 who has experienced losses due to COVID-19 – don’t miss your opportunity to apply for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program through @USDA. Applications must be submitted before December 11. https://t.co/ykuYies9qD

2021 Open Enrollment begins TODAY!   During the COVID-19 pandemic access to affordable quality health coverage is more important than ever. Visit https://t.co/VEwqJxTLaQ and #GetCovered before December 15. https://t.co/gqmy3uSX9s

.@USDA is now accepting a second round of applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. If you’re a farmer who has experienced losses due to COVID-19 don’t miss this opportunity to apply for direct disaster assistance. Click here for more info:https://t.co/jL9NlHYIKs
These measures will help keep more seniors safe and comfortable at home which is increasingly important as folks endure isolation from their families during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program is accepting a second round of applications from farmers who have been directly impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. Learn more about this important program that provides disaster assistance to local producers & apply today: https://t.co/Ukzm17HBTm

ICYMI – this week I introduced bipartisan legislation w/ @RepJohnKatko @RepMaxRose & @RepAnnieKuster which directs a study on how to prevent the spread of communicable diseases such as COVID-19 in nursing homes & assisted living facilities. Read more: https://t.co/frZtJeIb3U

Great to join the @GoMHSDukes public policy class this afternoon and talk about my work in Congress to ensure our communities have the resources they need to navigate the #COVID19 pandemic and the importance of using your vote and your voice to make positive change here at home. https://t.co/ZnqnTciJG2

.@JuneFarms is a beautiful agriculture operation with livestock and horses that includes an event venue and lodging. Today I visited West Sand Lake to hear from the owner about how his business has been impacted by #COVID19 and their experiences with federal programs. https://t.co/8sqObx9Yw2

I’m working at the federal level to advocate for additional coronavirus assistance that includes funding for state & local governments & my bipartisan Direct Support for Communities Act which would ensure that every locality – regardless of size – can access COVID-19 relief.

I’m proud to introduce the bipartisan Keeping Seniors Safe from COVID-19 Through Home Design Act which takes the necessary steps to address housing safety measures and stop the spread of COVID-19 among our most vulnerable populations.

The COVID-19 outbreaks we’ve seen in nursing homes across NY19 are heartbreaking. In addition to increased financial assistance & access to testing it is critically important that we determine what safety improvements can be made to protect our loved ones.https://t.co/frZtJeZLVs

.@FEMA’s Assistance to Firefighters Grant program is currently accepting applications for a second round of COVID relief funds. Learn more about the program & reach out to my Kingston office at (845) 443-2930 with additional questions. https://t.co/sFzUzdbiB9

This legislation gives small & mid-sized businesses in #NY19 who have faced substantial losses due to #COVID19 the resources they need to support payroll mortgage payments & fixed operating expenses. I’ll keep pushing to get RESTART included in future coronavirus relief bills.

#COVID19 has laid bare the urgent need for investments in rural broadband aimed at closing the #digitaldivide for our young people. I’m proud to announce this federal grant for @ONCBOCES that will help more students & teachers access the virtual classroom. https://t.co/aKQBAXuKCU

I will continue to call on the Senate Majority to take up House-passed #COVID19 relief legislation that provides funding for a second round of PPP loans through my Prioritized Paycheck Protection Program Act and resources for the small business community in #NY19.

Today is #WorldMentalHealthDay. During these periods of increased isolation everyone in our community is navigating multiple sources of stress. I will continue to advocate at the federal level for funding to support mental health care and treatment in future COVID-19 relief.

When the pandemic began I visited Sullivan County’s emergency facilities to learn how they were preparing for COVID-19. Today I returned to the municipal centers in Monticello to discuss the urgent need for state & local govt funding to help our communities recover and rebuild. https://t.co/dOAI97ExgP

I voted to pass an updated #HeroesAct to give our communities the resources they need to respond to COVID-19. Learn more here about the #smallbiz measures I worked to include that extend loan relief & allow smaller firms to secure additional PPP funding: https://t.co/Ir5BOzaPi7 https://t.co/qJYAKEe8IJ

Great meeting w/ Heidi Kirschner from @YMCA_Kingston Frank Russo from the Oneonta YMCA Jerry Huncosky from @frostvalley & representatives from @NYSYMCAs. We discussed our shared commitment to COVID relief that addresses the needs of non-profits & supports access to child care. https://t.co/k72qpc64Ex

Our legislation will strengthen the SBA Debt Relief program allowing more entrepreneurs to access relief and further extending qualified loan payments for businesses hardest-hit. I will keep pushing to get this bill included in future coronavirus stimulus packages.

Today I connected with my #NY19 Health Care Advisory Committee to learn more about how our local hospitals and community health centers are navigating #COVID19 and preparing for flu season. We also discussed the urgent need for additional coronavirus relief funding. https://t.co/RmfpMXdSgL

Great to connect with Dan Staley of Rhinebeck and Conor Gillis from @nardotrealtor. We discussed the urgent need for additional COVID-19 relief legislation that includes rental assistance for folks across #NY19. https://t.co/W4oHNXoJ4z

Important update: @USDA just announced a second round of disaster assistance for agriculture producers impacted by COVID-19 through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Applications open on Monday September 21. Learn more here: https://t.co/iwkLtfPKqc

The Otsego County Chamber of Commerce is holding a community webinar tomorrow at 7:00 p.m. w local health officials who will provide an update on public health insights into #COVID19 & how to apply this information to your business. Click here to register: https://t.co/kQYtcVcPM6 https://t.co/lGdxQbpUsA

This morning I spoke with the good folks @HRHCare in Amenia to hear about their experiences throughout the #COVID19 pandemic. During the call we also discussed the urgent need for additional COVID-19 relief legislation that includes state and local funding. https://t.co/eJCnRkm6A3

My office is constantly updating our #NY19 Coronavirus Resource Hub with new information about local #COVID19 testing sites food banks PPE and #smallbiz assistance. Find out more  ↓  https://t.co/mBUAM3UF10

The #COVID19 pandemic has caused increased stress & exacerbated mental health challenges for everyone. If you are having suicidal thoughts you are #NotAlone & there are resources available to help 24 hrs a day. Text NAMI to 741-741 or call @800273TALK. #WorldSuicidePreventionDay

The #RESTARTAct is a critical tool that provides additional resources to support payroll mortgage payments & fixed operating expenses for small & mid-sized businesses facing substantial losses due to COVID19. I’ll keep pushing to get this bill included in future relief packages. https://t.co/i7DNLyvVqP

#NY19 farmers have two days to apply for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program through the USDA. If you’ve experienced losses due to #COVID19 — click the link below to see if you qualify for disaster assistance & submit your application before Friday. https://t.co/ek9jTyVSOk

During a global pandemic it is critically important that we invest in access to health care & ensure hospitals can continue to provide urgently needed care in every community across our region. I’m proud to support the #COVID19 Hospital & Health Provider Loan Forgiveness Act. https://t.co/w3dEQnOYc3

Today I joined Mayor Trish Bergan & Village Trustees for a walk around Middleburgh. As our communities navigate COVID-19 I am checking in with small business owners across #NY19 to hear how they’re responding to the pandemic & understand their experiences with federal programs. https://t.co/w19Y7v39Pv

I joined @gillibrandny at @BethelWoods today to highlight the dire situation faced by venues & small & mid-sized businesses who are experiencing losses due to #COVID19. Congress must pass the #RESTARTAct & provide additional relief for businesses hardest-hit by the pandemic. https://t.co/svBk6vcMnn

Earlier this year during #COVID19 relief negotiations I urged the inclusion of funding for farmers impacted by the pandemic. These funds were included in the @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program or CFAP. Find info about the program & apply by 9/11:https://t.co/jL9NlHYIKs

Farmers in #NY19 are facing unique challenges as #COVID19 has disrupted food supply chains and travel. This morning I visited Chaseholm Farm in Pine Plains and learned from the owners about how they’ve utilized federal resources. https://t.co/CcsnoA4biJ
Businesses across our region will continue to need assistance long after the coronavirus pandemic and I’ll keep fighting to ensure Sullivan County gets every dollar they need to recover.

COVID-19 has caused unprecedented disruptions that will have lasting effects on our communities & infrastructure. I’m proud to have helped secure nearly $300000 in federal funding that will allow @SullivanCats to invest in #smallbiz recovery & development.https://t.co/g6Gy9cXcRC https://t.co/7R9stwI4bm

The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program which provides direct disaster payments to farmers who have experienced losses due to COVID-19 is accepting applications through September 11.   Find out here if you qualify & apply today: https://t.co/ek9jTyVSOk

#NY19 is home to thousands of unique small businesses that bring life to our main streets & employ our friends & family. Great to join Cooperstown Mayor Tillapaugh & local leaders to connect with #smallbiz owners about how they’re navigating COVID-19 & planning for the future. https://t.co/1eLRYwS3bI

This morning I joined Oneonta Mayor Gary Herzig to walk Main Street & meet with business owners in the city to discuss how they’re managing through the coronavirus pandemic. I will keep working to make sure our small businesses have the resources they need to stay operational. https://t.co/fYfuDMnXJs

With profit margins shrinking & costs increasing small farms in #NY19 need additional assistance. This week I visited family farmers in Palatine Bridge to hear about their experiences w federal #COVID19 programs & the unique challenges facing small farms.https://t.co/QibkQytXhv
Additional specialty crop growers can now apply for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program or CFAP run through the @USDA. Submit your application before September 11. https://t.co/oAPBCyLewf

Great to meet with Elina Rodriguez this afternoon & learn more about her work with the @borgenproject to eradicate international poverty. As countries across the globe battle COVID-19 efforts to support the most vulnerable populations worldwide are critically important. https://t.co/Vll1IABiS4

More than 100 days ago the House passed the #HeroesAct including my bipartisan Direct Support for Communities Act – legislation that would allow every single community in #NY19 regardless of size access to federal #COVID19 relief funding. The Senate must act.

I spent the afternoon at Free Bird Farm where I connected with the owners about their experiences during COVID-19. On the tour we discussed federal relief programs & my Helping America’s Farmers Act which would create an ag-specific Economic Injury Disaster Loan through @USDA. https://t.co/74A3L5DSWb

Important update for #NY19 #smallbiz—@SBAGov is still accepting applications for Economic Injury Disaster Loans (#EIDL) from businesses who have experienced losses due to #COVID19. Reach out to my office at 845-443-2930 for assistance with the application. https://t.co/Rg3bEuMm6u

Tourism is central to our economy in #NY19 & few industries have been hit harder by #COVID19. This morning I joined @sullivancats & business leaders in Sullivan for a listening session to hear about their experiences over the last several months & plans for the future. https://t.co/jFWn5hT6Fb

One year after my bipartisan Family Farmer Relief Act was signed into law I visited the Stamford Farmers’ Cooperative and toured the Martin Family Farm to hear about how Delaware County farmers have experienced the COVID-19 pandemic and how they’re preparing for the future. https://t.co/ZrkrIztokf

On Saturday a bipartisan coalition passed the Delivering for America Act which supports @USPS through emergency #COVID19 funding reverses changes that slow mail delivery & bars Postmaster General DeJoy from implementing future changes undermining the timely delivery of mail.

Great to connect with passionate advocates for music from across #NY19 today to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on musicians & music venues. Joined members on both sides of the aisle to urge Congressional leaders to prioritize funding for mental health & substance abuse in future #COVID19 relief. During these difficult times we must support both the physical & mental health of our communities. https://t.co/EAYuIYZNOv

While NY retreated indoors & worked & studied at home our essential workers & local governments have kept our communities running. Now they need our help. We must provide funding for state & local govts in future #COVID19 relief. My @TimesUnion op-ed: https://t.co/U0RVz1zmUJ

The #COVID19 pandemic has exacerbated an already difficult farm economy for farmers in #NY19. My bipartisan Small Farm to School Act supports our family farmers while helping our young people access more nutritious food in their school lunches. https://t.co/mSZW6S4j9c

#NY19 Farmers: The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) is now accepting applications through August 28. Sign up today to apply for resources to help cover COVID-related losses. More information from the @USDA here: https://t.co/jL9NlHH7lS

Today I connected with my #NY19 Health Care Advisory Committee to hear from folks about what they’re experiencing in health facilities as our region manages through #COVID19. I’m fighting for federal funds to support our hospitals & make sure our area has access to tests & PPE. https://t.co/pjIt2cg51w

Throughout #COVID19 our localities have continued essential services including public transit that allow our communities to function. I am proud to join in announcing critical funds that will modernize the UCAT fleet & protect our brave essential workers. https://t.co/YsoRe2hKZz

As the House and Senate negotiate the next steps of #coronavirus relief legislation I connected with my Small Business Advisory Committee to hear from #NY19 business owners and employees about their priorities in the weeks and months ahead. https://t.co/FA8wBpzoTW

Today I’m joining my colleagues on the House Agriculture Committee Commodity Exchanges Energy and Credit Subcommittee to discuss how our family farmers and rural communities are impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic. Tune in:  https://t.co/7Ty1cfisRL

Glad @TCFDiscovery has received urgently needed funds that will allow them to continue to provide invaluable care for our communities. Today is #TaxDay. Due to the coronavirus the deadline for individuals and businesses to complete your taxes was extended from April 15 to July 15. Find information about how to file your taxes or apply for an extension until October 15 here: https://t.co/xBUtjugdc6

Our family farmers & most vulnerable populations have experienced dire consequences from #COVID19. Great to speak with construction workers in #NY19 and across the state. I will continue to advocate for our construction industry on the Transportation & Infrastructure Committee as the House considers future coronavirus & infrastructure legislation. https://t.co/Mprub0KJPt

Our nation reached a devastating milestone as 100000 people have died from COVID19. Each life represents a neighbor friend child parent or grandparent. As we continue to battle this deadly disease my heart goes out to everyone who has lost a loved one.https://t.co/Qz4d9SmjU5

Have you joined one of my telephone town halls focused on #COVID19?
